trans-unit.source: Enables the blur effect on a specified window

seg-source.mrk: Enables the blur effect on a specified window

target.mrk: Enables the blur effect on a specified window

trans-unit.source: Parameters

seg-source.mrk: Parameters

target.mrk: Parameters

trans-unit.source: Handle to the window on which the blur behind data is applied.

seg-source.mrk: Handle to the window on which the blur behind data is applied.

target.mrk: Handle to the window on which the blur behind data is applied.

trans-unit.source: [optional] Specifies whether register or unregister the window handle to DWM blur behind, valid values:

seg-source.mrk: [optional]
Specifies whether register or unregister the window handle to DWM blur behind, valid values:

target.mrk: [optional]
Specifies whether register or unregister the window handle to DWM blur behind, valid values:

trans-unit.source: True - Register (Default).

seg-source.mrk: True - Register (Default).

target.mrk: True - Register (Default).

trans-unit.source: False - Unregister.

seg-source.mrk: False - Unregister.

target.mrk: False - Unregister.

trans-unit.source: [optional] Specifies whether colorize transition to match the maximized windows, valid values:

seg-source.mrk: [optional]
Specifies whether colorize transition to match the maximized windows, valid values:

target.mrk: [optional]
Specifies whether colorize transition to match the maximized windows, valid values:

trans-unit.source: True - The window's should be colorized.

seg-source.mrk: True - The window's should be colorized.

target.mrk: True - The window's should be colorized.

trans-unit.source: False - Otherwise (Default).

seg-source.mrk: False - Otherwise (Default).

target.mrk: False - Otherwise (Default).

trans-unit.source: [optional] The region within the client area to apply the blur behind.

seg-source.mrk: [optional]
The region within the client area to apply the blur behind.

target.mrk: [optional]
The region within the client area to apply the blur behind.

trans-unit.source: A value of zero (Default) will apply the blur behind the entire client area.

seg-source.mrk: A value of zero (Default) will apply the blur behind the entire client area.

target.mrk: A value of zero (Default) will apply the blur behind the entire client area.

trans-unit.source: Return Value

seg-source.mrk: Return Value

target.mrk: Return Value

trans-unit.source: 0 and sets the @error flag to non-zero, @extended flag may contain the HRESULT error code.

seg-source.mrk: 0 and sets the @error flag to non-zero, @extended flag may contain the HRESULT error code.

target.mrk: 0 and sets the @error flag to non-zero, @extended flag may contain the HRESULT error code.

trans-unit.source: Remarks

seg-source.mrk: Remarks

target.mrk: Remarks

trans-unit.source: The alpha values in the window are honored and the rendering atop the blur will use these alpha values.

seg-source.mrk: The alpha values in the window are honored and the rendering atop the blur will use these alpha values.

target.mrk: The alpha values in the window are honored and the rendering atop the blur will use these alpha values.

trans-unit.source: It is the application's responsibility for ensuring that the alpha values of all pixels in the window are correct.

seg-source.mrk: It is the application's responsibility for ensuring that the alpha values of all pixels in the window are correct.

target.mrk: It is the application's responsibility for ensuring that the alpha values of all pixels in the window are correct.

trans-unit.source: Some Windows Graphics Device Interface (GDI) operations do not preserve alpha values, so care must be taken when presenting child windows because the alpha values they contribute are unpredictable.

seg-source.mrk: Some Windows Graphics Device Interface (GDI) operations do not preserve alpha values, so care must be taken when presenting child windows because the alpha values they contribute are unpredictable.

target.mrk: Some Windows Graphics Device Interface (GDI) operations do not preserve alpha values, so care must be taken when presenting child windows because the alpha values they contribute are unpredictable.

trans-unit.source: This function must be called whenever Desktop Window Manager (DWM) composition is toggled.

seg-source.mrk: This function must be called whenever Desktop Window Manager (DWM) composition is toggled.

target.mrk: This function must be called whenever Desktop Window Manager (DWM) composition is toggled.

trans-unit.source: Handle the WM_DWMCOMPOSITIONCHANGED message for composition change notification.

seg-source.mrk: Handle the WM_DWMCOMPOSITIONCHANGED message for composition change notification.

target.mrk: Handle the WM_DWMCOMPOSITIONCHANGED message for composition change notification.

trans-unit.source: This function requires Windows Vista or later.

seg-source.mrk: This function requires Windows Vista or later.

target.mrk: This function requires Windows Vista or later.

trans-unit.source: Create the "sheet of glass" effect for the specified region. You must call this function whenever DWM composition is toggled.

seg-source.mrk: Create the "sheet of glass" effect for the specified region.
You must call this function whenever DWM composition is toggled.

target.mrk: Create the "sheet of glass" effect for the specified region.
You must call this function whenever DWM composition is toggled.
